result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin C. Santeford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dustin C. Santeford appeared by video. 
NO CONTEST to the charge in count 2, disorderly conduct.  Convicted.
State moves to dismiss and read in count 1.  Motion granted.
Defendant sentenced to five (5) days jail, Huber Law, to commence 05-24-2022 by 6:00pm.  Costs only, total $443.00 due in 60 days or 8 days jail for failure to pay.  DNA sample also ordered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2022 at 11:45 am.

10:24 AM Defendant Dustin C. Santeford appeared in court, Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his right to an attorney in this matter.  Court finds defendant freely, knowing and voluntarily waives his right and accepts Defendant's plea of not guilty.  Offer deadline March 11, 2022.
Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:09 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Dustin C. Santeford appeared in court. Defendant waives his right to counsel.  Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.
Arraignment is set for 02-22-22 at 10:30 a.m.

Arraignment on February 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
(given to defendant in court)
Order to report to MCSD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of threats to law enforcement.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-31-22 at 1:30 pm.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with any taverns or establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 01-10-2022
